ğŸš€ Scraperr | TypeScript
ğŸ¯ Primary Use Case: Web scraping and data extraction from websites.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ XPath-Based Extraction â€¢ Queue Management â€¢ Domain Spidering â€¢ Custom Headers â€¢ Media Downloads
ğŸ“– Summary: Scraperr is a self-hosted web scraping solution that allows users to scrape websites without writing code. It offers features like XPath-based extraction, queue management, domain spidering, and data export in various formats, making it a versatile tool for web data extraction.

ğŸš€ ssh-bot | Go
ğŸ¯ Primary Use Case: Remotely executing commands on servers or devices within a home network via a Telegram bot interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Executing commands on local or remote hosts via SSH â€¢ Support for parallel command execution â€¢ SSH connection manager with host availability check â€¢ Support for directory navigation â€¢ Combined access to remote hosts by key and/or password
ğŸ“– Summary: The ssh-bot is a Telegram bot written in Go that allows users to execute commands on remote hosts via SSH. It eliminates the need for VPNs or external IP addresses by providing asynchronous command execution and supports various authentication methods and configuration options.
ğŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ğŸ”“ Open Source

ğŸ’¡ inpaint-web | TypeScript
ğŸ¯ Primary Use Case: In-browser image inpainting and upscaling
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Image Inpainting (ä¿®å¤) â€¢ Super-Resolution (å›¾ç‰‡é«˜æ¸…åŒ–) â€¢ Image Modification History â€¢ Model Optimization â€¢ Post-Processing Integrated into the Model
ğŸ“– Summary: Inpaint-web is a free and open-source inpainting and image-upscaling tool that operates entirely within the browser using WebGPU and WASM technologies. It allows users to repair and enhance images directly in their browser without relying on server-side processing.
ğŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ğŸ”“ Open Source

ğŸš€ flint | TypeScript
ğŸ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing KVM virtual machines with a focus on ease of use and minimal overhead.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Modern Web UI (Next.js + Tailwind) â€¢ Single Binary (<11MB) â€¢ CLI and API for automation â€¢ Cloud-Init support â€¢ Snapshot-based template system
ğŸ“– Summary: Flint is a lightweight KVM management tool designed for developers, sysadmins, and home labs. It provides a modern web UI, CLI, and API for managing virtual machines, emphasizing simplicity and efficiency by avoiding XML and unnecessary bloat.
ğŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ğŸ”“ Open Source

ğŸš€ Disciplined-AI-Software-Development | Python
ğŸ¯ Primary Use Case: Collaborating with AI systems on software development projects to mitigate common issues like code bloat and architectural drift.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ AI Behavioral Configuration using custom instructions and persona frameworks
ğŸ“– Summary: The Disciplined AI Software Development methodology provides a structured approach for collaborating with AI systems on software development projects. It addresses common issues like code bloat, architectural drift, and context dilution through systematic constraints and validation checkpoints. The methodology uses four stages with systematic constraints, behavioral consistency enforcement, and validation checkpoints.
ğŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ğŸ”“ Open Source

ğŸ’¡ Daft | Rust
ğŸ¯ Primary Use Case: Large-scale data processing and analysis, including multimodal data, in distributed computing environments.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Familiar interactive API (Lazy Python Dataframe, SQL) â€¢ Powerful Query Optimizer â€¢ Data Catalog integrations (AWS Glue, Unity Catalog, Apache Iceberg) â€¢ Rich multimodal type-system (Images, URLs, Tensors) â€¢ Seamless Interchange (Apache Arrow)
ğŸ“– Summary: Daft is a distributed query engine, written in Rust, designed for large-scale data processing using Python or SQL. It focuses on providing a familiar interactive API, powerful query optimization, data catalog integrations, rich multimodal type-system, seamless interchange with Apache Arrow, and is built for cloud environments.
ğŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ğŸ”“ Open Source

ğŸ’¡ pocket-server | TypeScript
ğŸ¯ Primary Use Case: Running and managing AI agents locally and interacting with them remotely via a mobile application.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Agent runtime and tools â€¢ Native mobile terminal â€¢ File system + editor â€¢ Repo search â€¢ Background/cloud agents
ğŸ“– Summary: Pocket Server is a local runtime environment for AI agents, designed to run on a user's machine and be controlled via a mobile app. It provides core OS capabilities like agent runtime, a mobile terminal, file system access, and remote access, enabling users to interact with their codebase and agents from their phone.
ğŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ğŸ”“ Open Source

ğŸŒŸ zai-python-sdk | Python
ğŸ¯ Primary Use Case: Interacting with Z.AI's language models for chat completions and other language-based tasks.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automatic guest token authentication â€¢ Support for multiple AI models â€¢ Streaming and non-streaming responses â€¢ Customizable model parameters â€¢ Modular architecture
ğŸ“– Summary: The zai-python-sdk is an unofficial Python SDK for the Z.AI API, offering access to advanced language models like GLM-4.5V and 360B. It simplifies interaction with the API through features like automatic authentication, streaming responses, customizable parameters, and a modular architecture, without requiring an API key.
ğŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ğŸ”“ Open Source
